019package org.jgrapes.util;
020
021import java.math.BigDecimal;
022import java.time.Instant;
023import java.time.format.DateTimeParseException;
024import java.util.ArrayList;
025import java.util.Collection;
026import java.util.HashMap;
027import java.util.List;
028import java.util.Map;
029import java.util.Optional;
030import java.util.StringTokenizer;
031import java.util.TreeMap;
032import java.util.regex.Pattern;
033import java.util.stream.Collectors;
034import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
035import org.jgrapes.core.Component;
036import org.jgrapes.core.Event;
037import org.jgrapes.core.Manager;
038import org.jgrapes.core.annotation.Handler;
039import org.jgrapes.core.annotation.HandlerDefinition.ChannelReplacements;
040import org.jgrapes.util.events.InitialConfiguration;
041
042/**
043 * A base class for configuration stores. Implementing classes must
044 * override one of the methods {@link #structured(String)} or
045 * {@link #values(String)} as the default implementations of either
046 * calls the other. 
047 */
048@SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
049public abstract class ConfigurationStore extends Component {
050
051    public static final Pattern NUMBER = Pattern.compile("^\\d+$");
052
053    /**
054     * Creates a new component with its channel set to itself.
055     */
056    public ConfigurationStore() {
057        // Nothing to do.
058    }
059
060    /**
061     * Creates a new component base with its channel set to the given 
062     * channel. As a special case {@link Channel#SELF} can be
063     * passed to the constructor to make the component use itself
064     * as channel. The special value is necessary as you 
065     * obviously cannot pass an object to be constructed to its 
066     * constructor.
067     *
068     * @param componentChannel the channel that the component's
069     * handlers listen on by default and that 
070     * {@link Manager#fire(Event, Channel...)} sends the event to
071     */
072    public ConfigurationStore(Channel componentChannel) {
073        super(componentChannel);
074    }
075
076    /**
077     * Creates a new component base like {@link #ConfigurationStore(Channel)}
078     * but with channel mappings for {@link Handler} annotations.
079     *
080     * @param componentChannel the channel that the component's
081     * handlers listen on by default and that 
082     * {@link Manager#fire(Event, Channel...)} sends the event to
083     * @param channelReplacements the channel replacements to apply
084     * to the `channels` elements of the {@link Handler} annotations
085     */
086    public ConfigurationStore(Channel componentChannel,
087            ChannelReplacements channelReplacements) {
088        super(componentChannel, channelReplacements);
089    }
090
091    /**
092     * Configuration information should be kept simple. Sometimes, 
093     * however, it is unavoidable to structure the information 
094     * associated with a (logical) key. This can be done by 
095     * reflecting the structure in the names of actual keys, derived
096     * from the logical key. Names such as "key.0", "key.1", "key.2" 
097     * can be used to express that the value associated with "key" 
098     * is a list of values. "key.a", "key.b", "key.c" can be used 
099     * to associate "key" with a map from "a", "b", "c" to some values.
100     * 
101     * This methods looks at all values in the mapped passed as
102     * argument. If the value is a collection or map, the entry is
103     * converted to several entries following the pattern outlined
104     * above.
105     *
106     * @param structured the map with possibly structured properties
107     * @return the map with flattened properties
108     */
109    public static Map<String, Object> flatten(Map<String, ?> structured) {
110        @SuppressWarnings("PMD.UseConcurrentHashMap")
111        Map<String, Object> result = new HashMap<>();
112        flattenObject(result, null, structured);
113        return result;
114    }
115
116    @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "PMD.AvoidDuplicateLiterals" })
117    private static void flattenObject(Map<String, Object> result,
118            String prefix, Object value) {
119        if (value instanceof Map) {
120            for (var entry : ((Map<Object, Object>) value).entrySet()) {
121                if (entry.getKey().toString().startsWith("/")) {
122                    continue;
123                }
124                flattenObject(result,
125                    Optional.ofNullable(prefix).map(p -> p + ".").orElse("")
126                        + entry.getKey(),
127                    entry.getValue());
128            }
129            return;
130        }
131        if (value instanceof Collection) {
132            int count = 0;
133            for (var item : (Collection<?>) value) {
134                flattenObject(result, prefix + "." + count++, item);
135            }
136            return;
137        }
138        result.put(prefix, value);
139    }
140
141    /**
142     * Same as {@link #structure(Map, boolean)} with `false` as
143     * second argument.
144     *
145     * @param flatProperties the flat properties
146     * @return a map with structured values
147     */
148    @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops",
149        "PMD.ReturnEmptyCollectionRatherThanNull" })
150    public static Map<String, Object> structure(Map<String, ?> flatProperties) {
151        return structure(flatProperties, false);
152    }
153
154    /**
155     * The reverse operation to {@link #flatten(Map)}. Entries with
156     * key names matching the pattern outlined in {@link #flatten(Map)}
157     * are combined to a single entry with a structured value (map or
158     * list).
159     *
160     * Usually, only key patterns with consecutive numbers starting 
161     * with zero are converted to lists (e.g. `key.0`, `key.1`, `key.2`).
162     * If entries are missing, the values at that level are converted to 
163     * a `Map<Integer,Object>` with the given entries instead. If 
164     * `convertSparse` is `true`, incomplete index sets such as `key.2`,
165     * `key.3`, `key.5` are converted to lists with the available number 
166     * of elements despite the missing entries. 
167     * 
168     * If the derived class overrides {@link #structured(String)},
169     * the leaf values in the returned structure are the values
170     * provided by the overriding implementation (while 
171     * {@link #values(String))} always provides {@link String}s). 
172     * Some configuration formats define types other then string and
173     * therefore value can be e.g. {@link Integer}s or {@link Instant}s.
174     * In order to support the usage of arbitrary configuration store
175     * implementations, values obtained from the data structure returned
176     * by {@link #structure(Map, boolean)} should always be passed 
177     * through {@link #as(Object, Class)}. This method preserves
178     * non-string objects if they match the requested type or
179     * converts the value from its string representation to the
180     * requested type, if possible.
181     *
182     * @param flatProperties the flat properties
183     * @param convertSparse controls conversion to lists
184     * @return a map with structured values
185     */
186    @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops",
187        "PMD.ReturnEmptyCollectionRatherThanNull" })
188    public static Map<String, Object>
189            structure(Map<String, ?> flatProperties, boolean convertSparse) {
190        if (flatProperties == null) {
191            return null;
192        }
193        @SuppressWarnings("PMD.UseConcurrentHashMap")
194        Map<Object, Object> result = new HashMap<>();
195        for (var entry : flatProperties.entrySet()) {
196            @SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
197            Map<Object, Object> target = result;
198            // Original key (optionally) consists of dot separated parts
199            StringTokenizer parts = new StringTokenizer(entry.getKey(), ".");
200            while (true) {
201                var part = parts.nextToken();
202                Object key = NUMBER.matcher(part).find()
203                    ? Integer.parseInt(part)
204                    : part;
205                if (!parts.hasMoreTokens()) {
206                    // Last part (of key), store value
207                    target.put(key, entry.getValue());
208                    break;
209                }
210                @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
211                var newTarget = (Map<Object, Object>) target
212                    .computeIfAbsent(part, k -> new TreeMap<Object, Object>());
213                target = newTarget;
214            }
215        }
216
217        // Now convert all maps that have only Integer keys to lists
218        for (var entry : result.entrySet()) {
219            entry.setValue(maybeConvert(entry.getValue(), convertSparse));
220        }
221
222        // Return result
223        @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "rawtypes" })
224        Map<String, Object> res = (Map<String, Object>) (Map) result;
225        return res;
226    }
227
228    @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "PMD.ConfusingTernary" })
229    private static Object maybeConvert(Object value, boolean convertSparse) {
230        if (!(value instanceof TreeMap)) {
231            return value;
232        }
233        List<Object> converted = new ArrayList<>();
234        for (var entry : ((Map<Object, Object>) value).entrySet()) {
235            entry.setValue(maybeConvert(entry.getValue(), convertSparse));
236            if (converted == null) {
237                continue;
238            }
239            if (!(entry.getKey() instanceof Integer)
240                || !convertSparse
241                    && ((Integer) entry.getKey()) != converted.size()) {
242                // Don't convert, leave as Map.
243                converted = null;
244                continue;
245            }
246            converted.add(entry.getValue());
247        }
248        return converted != null ? converted : value;
249    }
250
251    /**
252     * Return the values for a given path if they exists. This
253     * method should only be used in cases where configuration values
254     * are needed before the {@link InitialConfiguration} event is
255     * fired, e.g. while creating the component tree. 
256     * 
257     * @param path the path
258     * @return the values, if defined for the given path
259     */
260    public Optional<Map<String, String>> values(String path) {
261        return structured(path).map(ConfigurationStore::flatten)
262            .map(o -> o.entrySet().stream()
263                .collect(Collectors.toMap(Map.Entry::getKey,
264                    e -> e.getValue().toString())));
265    }
266
267    /**
268     * Return the properties for a given path if they exists
269     * as structured data, see {@link #structure(Map)}.
270     * 
271     * @param path the path
272     * @return the values, if defined for the given path
273     */
274    public Optional<Map<String, Object>> structured(String path) {
275        return values(path).map(ConfigurationStore::structure);
276    }
277
278    /**
279     * If the value is not `null`, return it as the requested type.
280     * The method is successful if the value already is of the
281     * requested type (or a subtype) or if the value is of type
282     * {@link String} and can be converted to the requested type. 
283     * 
284     * Supported types are:
285     * * {@link String}
286     * * {@link Number}
287     * * {@link Instant}
288     * * {@link Boolean}
289     * 
290     * @return the value
291     */
292    @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "PMD.ShortMethodName" })
293    public static <T> Optional<T> as(Object value, Class<T> requested) {
294        // Handle null.
295        if (value == null) {
296            return Optional.empty();
297        }
298        // Is of requested type?
299        if (requested.isAssignableFrom(value.getClass())) {
300            return Optional.of((T) value);
301        }
302        // Convert to String, if requested.
303        if (requested.equals(String.class)) {
304            return Optional.of((T) value.toString());
305        }
306        // Remaining conversions require a string representation.
307        if (!(value instanceof String)) {
308            return Optional.empty();
309        }
310        if (requested.equals(Number.class)) {
311            try {
312                return Optional.of((T) new BigDecimal((String) value));
313            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
314                return Optional.empty();
315            }
316        }
317        if (requested.equals(Instant.class)) {
318            try {
319                return Optional.of((T) Instant.parse((String) value));
320            } catch (DateTimeParseException e) {
321                return Optional.empty();
322            }
323        }
324        if (requested.equals(Boolean.class)) {
325            return Optional.of((T) Boolean.valueOf((String) value));
326        }
327        return Optional.empty();
328    }
329
330    /**
331     * Short for `as(value, String.class)`.
332     *
333     * @param value the value
334     * @return the optional
335     */
336    public static Optional<String> asString(Object value) {
337        return as(value, String.class);
338    }
339
340    /**
341     * Short for `as(value, Number.class)`.
342     *
343     * @param value the value
344     * @return the optional
345     */
346    public static Optional<Number> asNumber(Object value) {
347        return as(value, Number.class);
348    }
349
350    /**
351     * Short for `as(value, Instant.class)`.
352     *
353     * @param value the value
354     * @return the optional
355     */
356    public static Optional<Instant> asInstant(Object value) {
357        return as(value, Instant.class);
358    }
359
360    /**
361     * Short for `as(value, Boolean.class)`.
362     *
363     * @param value the value
364     * @return the optional
365     */
366    public static Optional<Boolean> asBoolean(Object value) {
367        return as(value, Boolean.class);
368    }
369}
